TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content: Could this possibly be an issue with the camera renderer not updating for Scatterer when the vessel's orbital altitude is changed (by cheating) and thus still rendering the effects of a different (lower altitude)?

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, blackrack said:
> 
> 
> Normally, this box surrounds the camera and you can never have this viewpoint of it. Are you using any mods that affect camera position?
> 

Hi, thanks for the reply 

I don't remember which mods I used back at that time and I switched many installs since then but I'm pretty sure there were no mods that messed with the camera, I suspect that it had something to do with sigma dimensions or with the camera FOV settings, either way I haven't seen that issue since then

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, NeoFatalis said:
> 
> 
> Hi, thanks for the reply 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I don't remember which mods I used back at that time and I switched many installs since then but I'm pretty sure there were no mods that messed with the camera, I suspect that it had something to do with sigma dimensions or with the camera FOV settings, either way I haven't seen that issue since then
> 

This is an issue that is caused by Sigma Dimensions and more specifically, the fadeStart and fadeEnd parameters in Kopernicus. Scatterer does not play nice with scaled systems currently.

> 
> 
> 16 hours ago, blackrack said:
> 
> 
> Does just installing sigma binary cause this issue or is there a specific way to configure it or use it that causes this? What does sigma binary do exactly?
> 

**Sigma Binary** adds the ability for bodies to orbit about a barycenter. Nothing in stock does this, but the Outer Planets Mod adds a Pluto/Charon equivalent called Plock/Karen. With Sigma Binary, they twirl about each other like two ice skaters. With time acceleration, the effect is profound.

It's cool to plan an approach to a system that's wobbling like that. One false move and you'll impact your molars into a dwarf planet.

One doesn't *need* Sigma Binary, which is why I was cool with dumping it. It's just interesting fluff. I have not tried running just that and OPM with no other mods.

if you need help figuring out what's going on let me know

maybe I can be of assistance in explaining what SB does

> 
> 19 hours ago, Poodmund said:
> 
> 
> Assuming this was on Gael, Gael uses an experimentalAtmoScale of 1.6, at a 10x sized Gael that atmospheric stretch will become quite pronounced. Could there be an issue where the very low part of the scatterer effect at the 0km level is being rendered above the ground?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Also Gael has a [0] configPoint at 200m consisting of the following:
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     
>     
>     Item
>     {altitude = 200skyAlpha = 0.8skyExposure = 0skyRimExposure = 0.25postProcessAlpha = 0.5postProcessDepth = 0.08postProcessExposure = 0.2skyExtinctionMultiplier = 2skyExtinctionTint = 1skyextinctionRimFade = 0skyextinctionGroundFade = 0openglThreshold = 10edgeThreshold = 0.1viewdirOffset = 0.001_Post_Extinction_Tint = 1postExtinctionMultiplier = 0.9_GlobalOceanAlpha = 1_extinctionScatterIntensity = 1
>     }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Does anything in there look suspect to you, [@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/)?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Should the lowest altitude of the first configPoint always be 0m?
> 

No everything looks fine, if the lowest config point is 200 covers 0-200. try different values of experimentalAtmoScale and see if there is any effect at all. Else try slightly lower values of HR and HM in the config tool

> 
> 
> 16 hours ago, stratvox said:
> 
> 
> Hey, [@blackrack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/104258-blackrack/), glad to see you're back ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 
> 
> 
> I pretty much need to include [@Galileo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/150430-galileo/) here too, as I'm pretty sure this is an interface between SVE and scatterer.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I was wondering if you saw the post I made [here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/103963-wip122-scatterer-atmospheric-scattering-v00300-22012017/&do=findComment&comment=2982159). I have more info about it, and I'm pretty sure it's related to the disappearing clouds.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The magic altitude that causes this is 160km. If I'm in map view when my craft ascends past 160km, when I return to craft view I get the effect you see in my screenshot in the linked post. However, if I am in craft view when I ascend past 160km, then it works as it's supposed to. When I do get this effect, it's necessary for me to leave the craft and go back to the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> to make it go away.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The disappearing clouds seems to be related to using the <abbr title="Kerbal Alarm Clock (mod)">KAC</abbr> jump to ship functionality. When I use <abbr title="Kerbal Alarm Clock (mod)">KAC</abbr> to jump to ship from the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr>, if the craft is above 160km I end up with no clouds. However, if I use the tracking station to get to the craft, the clouds are there. I'm mostly bringing this up because the altitudes are the same, even if the mechanic is different.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Latest KSP, up to date linux with up to date nvidia drivers.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> It's more of an annoyance than anything since I now have complete workarounds for all the things I mention here, but I thought you might like to know.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Oh, and a few posts before the one I link I left a couple of eye-candies for you. Scatterer makes the overall experience of KSP sooooo much better. Has no material effect on the *game*, but has a huge one on the *experience* of playing the game. Thanks!
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Hope you're having a good evening!
> 

Ok, guess I will check it out with <abbr title="Kerbal Alarm Clock (mod)">KAC</abbr> when i have time.

First, thanks for the great mod. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Is there a chance to maybe get these **two exceptions** (going into the TS and back to the SC) **fixed**, very much please? It makes me crazy to see these exceptions so often and I am waiting for a fix since V0.300 release. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

I have a highly modded install, cause of that I need to have the exceptions turned on, to notice when something goes wrong. But these log I made with a **very small modded installation** and with **Scatterer in its own config**.

PS: This could be used to also sync back the version number of the binary with the version number of the release. Which confused some people.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-04-13T14:36:51Z" title="04/13/2017 02:36  PM" data-short="7 yr">April 13, 2017</time> by Galileo**

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, TampaPowers said:
> 
> 
> Yay forum breaking log files... or something, uploaded it instead: [https://transfer.sh/HQS59/KSP.log](https://transfer.sh/HQS59/KSP.log)
> 

I need to see the output log not the KSP log..

BUT I think the issue is the shadow strength of <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>. Try opening the <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> GUI (**alt+0**) and navigate to the **Cloud Manager**. Choose an Eve cloud layer and scroll down to the bottom and look for a **shadowMaterial** setting and set it 0 or 0.1 or whatever works for you on each layer. If that is the problem, doing this will brighten Eve's surface.

[https://transfer.sh/B2Kcv/output_log.txt](https://transfer.sh/B2Kcv/output_log.txt)

Going to try what you suggested when I get home later.

EDIT: OK I removed them, still a bit dark for my taste but I suppose thats why the clouds are there. May have to see if I can find some nice configs somewhere, thanks for the help though!

Fixed

I need help, please. Total newbie here and I really have no clue what is going on.

I'm getting a pink kerbin in map view (and on the start screen) and I can't figure out what is wrong. I've tried uninstalling Scatterer via <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> and then verifying the steam files. Nothing seems to be helping.
